ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Beat patterns, some score reading, how to rehearse musicians.
I learned how to count better and read scores easier. I dont think I need to hear a piece before conducting it anymore.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The pieces we conducted were helpful to facilitate learning and got harder as the semester progressed. The other students in the class were very strong musicians, which made the class fun and engaging. Professor Boughton also gave helpful feedback. However there were so many students in the class that  each student did not actually get very much time to conduct, as everyone needed to have a turn. So I ended up conducting once for 10 minutes about every 3 classes and not getting much in-class practice. I wish that there had been fewer students in the class or that the time had been managed better.
Some students dont know about imslp so maybe send an announcement at the beginning of the course talking about that and what the first piece is.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, this was a very good course.
Yes if you're looking for an extremely low workload class, just be prepared to conduct in front of a small ensemble roughly every 1.5 weeks
Yes. Its fun to listen to fellow classmates play so beautifully and its an honor to conduct them. Take notes on scores and it will make it much easier to perform.
